name: The Block
title: Kekius Maximus Memecoin Plunges After Elon Musk Profile Change
text:
Synopsis
The cryptocurrency market experienced volatility driven by Elon Musk's social media activity and continued institutional interest in Ethereum ETFs, with regulatory developments and market sentiment indicating cautious optimism for 2025.

Key Insights
- Kekius Maximus memecoin experienced a 75% price plunge after Elon Musk reverted his X profile, having previously surged to a $380 million market cap
- Spot Ethereum ETFs attracted record monthly inflows of $2 billion in December, with BlackRock's ETHA leading with $1.4 billion in net inflows
- The IRS delayed implementing new crypto cost-basis reporting rules until January 1, 2026, giving brokers more time to adapt
- Bitcoin recovered to trade above $97,000, with futures funding rates suggesting cautious market optimism
- The long-running "Week in Ethereum" newsletter is shutting down due to reduced Ethereum Foundation funding, raising concerns about developer talent retention
- U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs saw net inflows of over $4.5 billion in December, though lower than November's all-time high
